text:
Last May, @MichaelWorobey wrote a column asking scientists to keep an open mind about a natural v lab origin of Covid.

But data accumulated & he sifted: “When you look at all of the evidence, it is clear that this started at the market.” 
My story @Nature https://t.co/Txz9E9p5fZ
RT @amymaxmen: Three new studies boost the idea that the pandemic began when an animal sold at a market in Wuhan spread SARS-CoV-2 to a per…

Several lines of evidence are converging on the Huanan market & an animal origin of Covid. 

But the flow of information is slow & insufficient to definitively nail it down. Still, the intel we have on Covid origins is far better than for Ebola outbreaks.
https://t.co/Txz9E9p5fZ

Three new studies boost the idea that the pandemic began when an animal sold at a market in Wuhan spread SARS-CoV-2 to a person. Twice.

My piece on important new papers by @K_G_Andersen @edwardcholmes @MichaelWorobey & others:

Miscommunication from the CDC undermines public trust in science & science institutions. Not good if you, like me, are disturbed by 3000 Americans dying of Covid per day. https://t.co/U9DhOGpEwJ https://t.co/4tpynWof8v
RT @carmendrahl: The pandemic has been a boom time for epic threads. Right away I was drawn to this by @amymaxmen. With charts, political c…
A desire to immediately go back to "normal" could end up sustaining the pandemic, warns @DrMikeRyan https://t.co/4Sr6kny1iq
RT @PeterHotez: More evidence ⁦@JAMAInternalMed⁩ finding no effectiveness of ivermectin vs Covid. As someone who is responsible as anyone f…
RT @PeterHotez: We call this “weaponized health communication” linked to deadly health freedom defiance that has caused the Covid deaths of…

Researchers report on close cousins to SARS-CoV-2, found in cave-dwelling bats in Laos. These coronaviruses bind well to receptors on human cells, replicate in those cells & SARS2 antibodies block them. https://t.co/Nk9SFEGJSf

Many viruses have severe, long-term effects that healthy people prefer to ignore. I fear Covid will be no different.

@lfspinney on the invisibility of disability. https://t.co/w2Jm3aFFcO
RT @past_is_future: @sciam is devoting its whole March issue to COVID-19, and I am proud to have co-written a piece with virologist @stuart…

Last May, I was criticized & harassed for writing a piece warning that the tone of the lab-leak debate would hinder Covid origin investigations & damage collaboration required to curb this & future pandemics. https://t.co/IEk1ufBrFZ

Now it's happening. https://t.co/1LScDlDX3E

Finally. An in-depth feature on coronavirus research at Wuhan Institute of Virology. @janeqiuchina captures the science, the scientists & the politics.

Read through to the crushing end. https://t.co/32c3FRibhg

mRNA vaccines are the #1 tool agst Covid right now, but largely unavailable in poorer countries.

⬆️ production so that everyone in lower income countries gets 2 would prevent 1.3 million deaths & cost $35.5b ($27K/life).By @gregggonsalves @zainrizvi et al https://t.co/JOuRS93kJz
